skill.name: compound-docs
skill.description: Capture solved problems as searchable documentation with pattern detection. This skill auto-triggers when users confirm a fix worked ("that worked", "it's fixed", "working now") or manually via /compound command.
skill.summary: Auto-capture and document solved problems with pattern detection for searchable knowledge bases.
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with example bash commands in code blocks. The 'backticks' flagged are markdown code fences, not Ruby/shell execution. No executable code detected. The skill provides documentation templates for capturing solved problems.

content.value_statement: Teams repeatedly solve the same problems. This skill auto-detects when fixes work and captures them as searchable documentation with pattern detection to prevent recurring issues.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detects when users confirm a fix worked via trigger phrases like "that worked" or "it's fixed"
Extracts context including symptoms, root cause, category, and solution from conversation
Creates standardized documentation using YAML frontmatter and markdown templates
Checks for similar existing issues to avoid duplicates and enable pattern promotion
Updates schema.yaml with new enum values as needed for extensibility
Promotes recurring issues to patterns.md for prominent visibility
limitations: Requires user confirmation that a fix actually worked before documenting
Skips trivial fixes like typos and simple syntax errors
Depends on clear conversation context to extract accurate information
Does not execute code or interact with external systems

use_cases.title: Document recurring deployment issues
use_cases.description: Capture Docker, CI/CD, and infrastructure fixes so the team can quickly reference solutions instead of rediscovering them during incidents.

use_cases.title: Build a team knowledge base
use_cases.description: Automatically capture bug fixes and workarounds as they happen, building searchable documentation over time without manual effort.

use_cases.title: Surface patterns in repeated errors
use_cases.description: Detect when the same issue occurs multiple times and promote it to patterns.md for team-wide visibility and prevention.

prompt_templates.title: Basic fix documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the compound-docs skill to document our solution. We just fixed [describe the problem]. The fix was [describe what worked].

prompt_templates.title: Detailed issue capture
prompt_templates.prompt: Document this debugging session. The error was [error message], we tried [attempts that failed], and the solution was [what finally worked]. Category: [developer-experience|deployment|ui|integration|performance|testing].

prompt_templates.title: Pattern promotion request
prompt_templates.prompt: Check how many times this issue has occurred and promote to patterns.md if it meets the threshold. The issue is [describe the recurring problem].

prompt_templates.title: Schema extension
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new category/component/root_cause value to schema.yaml. We need to document issues related to [new category] because existing ones do not fit.

output_examples.input: That worked! The Docker build was failing because of the cache issue.
output: Great! Let me document this fix.
Current categories: developer-experience, deployment, ui, integration, performance, testing
Symptom: Docker build failing with 'layer not found' error
Solution: Added --no-cache flag and updated base image tag
Prevention: Pin base image versions, use docker system prune periodically

output_examples.input: It's fixed! The API was returning 401 because the auth header was missing.

best_practices: Wait for clear confirmation that a fix actually worked before documenting
Provide complete context including what was tried and failed before the solution
Add prevention strategies like tests, linting rules, or monitoring to each doc
Review patterns.md before making changes to leverage existing knowledge
anti_patterns: Documenting without confirming the fix is complete and tested
Skipping the check for similar existing issues
Not adding prevention strategies to documented solutions
Leaving out what was tried before the working solution

faq.question: What triggers the compound-docs skill?
faq.answer: The skill auto-triggers on phrases like 'that worked', 'it's fixed', 'working now', 'problem solved', or 'that did it'. You can also manually invoke it with /compound.

faq.question: Does it document every fix automatically?
faq.answer: No. It skips trivial fixes like typos and simple syntax errors. It only documents non-obvious solutions that provide value to the team.

faq.question: Where are the documents saved?
faq.answer: Documents are saved to {output_dir}/{category}/{filename} with format {sanitized-symptom}-{YYYYMMDD}.md.

faq.question: How does pattern promotion work?
faq.answer: When the same issue occurs 2 or more times, the skill prompts to promote it to patterns.md for prominent visibility across all future sessions.

faq.question: Can I extend the categories?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can add new enum values to schema.yaml for categories, components, and root_cause fields as needed.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill uses grep and bash for searching existing docs and creating directories. All operations are read-only on user files.
